title: Ticket #5168: Increase rate of schedd job completion
description:
We have some schedds where the average job finish rate is greater than the duty cycle rate. This results in an accumulation of jobs in 'C' state - more than 100k in one case.

As there are lots of unnecessary ads in the queue, queue scanning and hash table operations take longer - resulting in a longer duty cycle and more jobs in queue.

We should expose a knob to manage the number of completions done per duty cycle
remarks:
2015-Jul-28 08:02:55 by bbockelm:
Just to follow up -

This has been a complete lifesaver within CMS. We found that our schedds could sustain a higher rate of "real job completion" (i.e., shadow finished the job) than they could sustain removing the proc from the queue.

We observed multiple cases over the past two weeks that were only solvable by this patch (or by having an operator log in and setting MAX_JOBS_RUNNING=0 and waiting until the issue has resolved). On nodes with the patch applied, this issue has not returned.

I see no reason why someone would want to tune this knob; hence, I am not creating a param table entry.

Jaime, can you review?

Brian

2015-Jul-28 09:30:02 by jfrey:
Code Review

I'm hesitant to increase the default count-per-interval setting of job_is_finished_queue to 8 without additional changes. Several jobs that have spool directories with a large number of files could block the schedd for a prolonged period. I'd like to see the addition of a time-based limit or make spool directory cleanup less of a synchronous operation.

2015-Jul-28 14:03:08 by bbockelm:
What about just waiting to merge until after #5152?

2015-Jul-28 16:08:28 by jfrey:
That depends on how #5152 is implemented. If the schedd doesn't block waiting for the spool directory removal to finish, then sure.
